text: Arhopala selta or reddish-brown oakblue, is a butterfly in the family Lycaenidae. It was described by William Chapman Hewitson in 1869. It is found in the Indomalayan realm.Seitz, A., 1912-1927. Die Indo-Australien Tagfalter Grossschmetterlinge Erde 9 ==Subspecies== *A. s. selta Burma, Mergui, Peninsular Malaya, Thailand, Sumatra *A. s. constanceae de Nicéville, 1894 Andaman Islands *A. s. hislopi Eliot, 1962 Malaysia ==References== ==External links== *Arhopala Boisduval, 1832 at Markku Savela's Lepidoptera and Some Other Life Forms. Retrieved June 3, 2017. Category:Arhopala Category:Butterflies described in 1869
title: Arhopala selta
